Detailed Description

A basic but full-featured implementation of a VRT IF Context packet.



The following implementation is used for the HasFields methods: 

     ID | Name                     | Type
    ----+--------------------------+------------------
    N+0 | ChangePacket             | Bool
    N+1 | ReferencePointIdentifier | Int32
    N+2 | Bandwidth                | Double
    N+3 | FrequencyIF              | Double
    N+4 | FrequencyRF              | Double
    N+5 | FrequencyOffsetRF        | Double
    N+6 | BandOffsetIF             | Double
    N+7 | ReferenceLevel           | Float
    N+8 | Gain                     | Float
    N+9 | Gain1                    | Float (can not set to null)
    N+10| Gain2                    | Float (can not set to null)
    N+11| OverRangeCount           | Int64
    N+12| SampleRate               | Double
    N+13| SamplePeriod             | Double
    N+14| TimeStampAdjustment      | Int64
    N+15| TimeStampCalibration     | Int32
    N+16| Temperature              | Float
    N+17| DeviceID                 | String
    N+18| CalibratedTimeStamp      | BoolNull
    N+19| DataValid                | BoolNull
    N+20| ReferenceLocked          | BoolNull
    N+21| SignalDetected           | BoolNull
    N+22| InvertedSpectrum         | BoolNull
    N+23| OverRange                | BoolNull
    N+24| Discontinuous            | BoolNull
    N+25| UserDefinedBits          | Int8
    N+26| DataPayloadFormat        | PayloadFormat
    N+27| GeolocationGPS           | Geolocation
    N+28| GeolocationINS           | Geolocation
    N+29| EphemerisECEF            | Ephemeris
    N+30| EphemerisRelative        | Ephemeris
    N+31| EphemerisReference       | Int32
    N+32| GeoSentences             | GeoSentences
    N+33| ContextAssocLists        | ContextAssocLists
    // TODO - update comment w/ accurate CIF0 info, and additional CIFs
    // TODO - also update hasFields implementation, of course
    ----+--------------------------+------------------
    (N = number of fields in BasicVRTPacket)

size_t  len,
bool  readOnly = false

Creates a new instance accessing the given data buffer.

Parameters:
buf The pointer to the packet buffer.
len The length of the packet buffer.
readOnly Should users of this instance be able to modify the underlying data buffer?
vrt::BasicContextPacket::BasicContextPacket (  ) 

Creates a new instance that can be written to.

Initially this will just be a simple context packet with no fields set (other than the required packet length of 8 and a default stream ID of 0).

vrt::BasicContextPacket::BasicContextPacket ( int32_t  bufsize  ) 

Creates a new instance with a default anticipated length that can be written to.

Initially this will just be a simple context packet with no fields set (other than the required packet length of 8 and a default stream ID of 0), but will have the underlying buffers pre-allocated as required.

Parameters:
bufsize The anticipated buffer size.
vrt::BasicContextPacket::BasicContextPacket ( const vector< char > &  buf,
bool  readOnly = false 
)

Creates a new instance accessing the given data buffer.

Note that when the buffer lengths are given, only the most minimal of error checking is done. Users should call isPacketValid() to verify that the packet is valid. Invalid packets can result unpredictable behavior, but this is explicitly allowed (to the extent possible) so that applications creating packets can use this class even if the packet isn't yet "valid".

Parameters:
buf The data buffer to use.
readOnly Should users of this instance be able to modify the underlying data buffer?
Exceptions:
VRTException If the offset is negative or greater than the length of the buffer given. Also thrown if the buffer length is -1 and a copy can not be made because the sizes in the header of the packet are invalid.

PacketType  type,
int64_t  classID,
int32_t  minPayloadLength,
int32_t  maxPayloadLength

maxPayloadLength The maximum payload length (<0 if not pre-defined).
Exceptions:
VRTException If packet type or classID of the packet are invalid, or if the payload length is invalid.

TimeStamp vrt::BasicContextPacket::getAdjustedTimeStamp (  )  const [inline]

Gets the adjusted time stamp of the packet.

This is implemented as follows: 

  public: TimeStamp getAdjustedTimeStamp () const {
    int64_t adj = getTimeStampAdjustment();
    return (adj == INT64_NULL)? getTimeStamp() : getTimeStamp().addPicoSeconds(adj);
  }
Returns:
The adjusted time stamp of the packet (never null).

References vrt::TimeStamp::addPicoSeconds(), vrt::BasicVRTPacket::getTimeStamp(), and vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider::getTimeStampAdjustment().

virtual string vrt::BasicContextPacket::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::StandardContextPacket.

virtual ValueType vrt::BasicContextPacket::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

GeoSentences vrt::BasicContextPacket::getGeoSentences ( IndicatorFieldEnum_t  cif7field = CIF_NULL  )  const [inline, virtual]

Gets the GPS ASCII "sentences".

These are ASCII "sentences" from a GPS (Global Positioning System) receiver, such as those conforming to NMEA-0183. Due to the great variety in GPS "sentences", this class makes little effort to do anything useful with them. Users are encouraged to use getGeolocationGPS() which essentially provides the same information, but in a consistent form.

Parameters:
cif7field Indicator field for the CIF7 attribute.
Returns:
The geolocation information (null if not specified). Note that changes to the returned object do not alter the packet.

Implements vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider.

References vrt::IndicatorFields::getCIFBitMask(), vrt::IndicatorFields::getCIFNumber(), getOffset(), and vrt::BasicVRTPacket::unpackPayloadRecord().

virtual int32_t vrt::BasicContextPacket::getOffset ( int8_t  cifNum,
int32_t  field 
) const [protected, virtual]

Gets the offset for the given context indicator field relative to the location of the first occurrence of CIF0.

CIF7 is considered an invalid CIF number. For access to the second occurrence of CIFs (i.e. Error fields in Ack packets), add 8 to the CIF number, effectively setting the 4th bit (mod8 gives field, div8 gives occurrence).

Parameters:
cifNum number of CIF that field belongs to.
field bitmask associated with field of interest.
Returns:
offset in bytes from beginning of CIF payload, or CIF7 as described above.
Exceptions:
VRTException If the CIF number is invalid.

Implements vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider.

Referenced by get3DPointingVectorStructured(), getCIFsArray(), getContextAssocLists(), getDataPayloadFormat(), getEphemeris(), getGeolocation(), getGeoSentences(), getIndexList(), getSectorScanStep(), and getSpectrumField().

virtual string vrt::BasicContextPacket::getPacketValid ( bool  strict,
int32_t  length 
) const [virtual]

Checks to see if the packet is valid.

This is identical to isPacketValid(int32_t) except that a description of the error is returned.

Parameters:
strict Should strict checking be done, or just enough to verify that things are OK for reading. No packet failing strict checking should ever be sent out, but it may be useful to disable strict checking when reading in a packet.
length Verifies that the length of the packet matches this value.
Returns:
Empty string ("") if it is valid, a description of the error otherwise.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicControlPacket, and vrt::StandardContextPacket.

virtual boolNull vrt::BasicContextPacket::getStateEventBit ( int32_t  enable,
int32_t  indicator,
int32_t  cif7bit 
) const [protected, virtual]

Gets the specified bit from the State and Event Indicator field.

Parameters:
enable Bit position of the enable flag.
indicator Bit position of the indicator flag.
cif7bit Bit position of the CIF7 indicator flag.
Returns:
null if field is not present, null if the enable bit is not set, true if the enable bit is set and the indicator bit is set, false if the enable bit is set but the indicator bit is not set.

Implements vrt::IndicatorFieldProvider.

virtual bool vrt::BasicContextPacket::isChangePacket (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Indicates if any fields have changes since the last packet in this stream.

Packet streams that do not support this concept, should always return true indicating that the recipient must read the packet to determine if there was a change. An IF Data stream will always return true.

Returns:
true if anything in the packet may have changed since the last context packet, false if nothing has changed since the last context packet.

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

Reimplemented in vrt::BasicControlPacket.

virtual bool vrt::BasicContextPacket::resetForResend ( const TimeStamp &  t  )  [virtual]

Prepares a packet for resend resetting any non-persistent values and clearing the context change flags.

This is implemented as follows: 

    bool BasicContextPacket::resetForResend (const TimeStamp &t) {
      BasicVRTPacket::resetForResend(t);
      setChangePacket(false);
      setOverRangeCount(null);
      setOverRange(null);
      setDiscontinuous(null);
      return true;
    }
Parameters:
t The new time stamp.
Returns:
true

Reimplemented from vrt::BasicVRTPacket.

virtual void vrt::BasicContextPacket::setStateEventBit ( int32_t  enable,

boolNull  value,
int32_t  cif7bit 
) [protected, virtual]

Sets the specified bit of the State and Event Indicator field.

Parameters:

indicator Bit position of the indicator flag.
value The value of the bits: null if the enable bit should not be set, true if the enable bit and the indicator bit should be set, false if the enable bit should be set but the indicator bit should not be set.
